Running on [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] 8, using [[Wine (software)|Wine]].]]'''EchoLink''' is a computer program that runs under [[Microsoft Windows]] to allow [[radio amateur]]s to communicate with one another using [[Voice over IP]] (VoIP) technology on the [[internet]] for at least part of the path between them. [[Image:Screenshot-EchoLink.png|thumb|200px|Echolink v2.0.908 screenshot. Running on [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]] 8, using [[Wine (software)|Wine]].]]'''EchoLink''' is a computer program that runs under [[Microsoft Windows]] to allow [[radio amateur]]s to communicate with one another using [[Voice over IP]] (VoIP) technology on the [[internet]] for at least part of the path between them. It was designed by Jonathan Taylor, a radio amateur with [[callsign]] K1RFD.
The program allows reliable worldwide connections to be made between radio amateurs, greatly enhancing Amateur Radio's communications capabilities. In essence it is the same as other VoIP applications (such as [[Skype]]), but with the unique addition of the ability to link to an [[amateur radio station]]'s [[transceiver]].
The program allows reliable worldwide connections to be made between radio amateurs, greatly enhancing Amateur Radio's communications capabilities. In essence it is the same as other VoIP applications (such as [[Skype]]), but with the unique addition of the ability to link to an [[amateur radio station]]'s [[transceiver]].
